subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Rafael Nadal, fatigued from a nearly four-hour match the previous day, was routed by fourth-seeded Mikhail Youzhny, 6-0, 6-1, Sunday in the final of the Chennai Open in India.The 19th-ranked Youzhny clinched the fourth title of his career. The second-ranked Nadal held his service only once.The 57-minute match turned out to be a letdown for Nadal, who needed 3 hours 54 minutes to overcome his fellow Spaniard Carlos Moyá in what was the longest three-set match on the ATP Tour in 15 years.“Rafa was not Rafa,” Youzhny said. “I did not win today, it was Rafa who lost. I did not expect it to be so easy.”.
